Canada's National Advisory Committee on Immunization recommends that all pregnant women get the pertussis (whooping cough) vaccine in every pregnancy to help protect the baby after birth. The pertussis vaccine is given as the tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis (Tdap) vaccine. In BC, anyone who is not eligible for a free Tdap vaccine can purchase it at most pharmacies and travel clinics.
